intro: Mesembryanthemum heteropetalum, commonly known as the variable-flowered ice plant, is a succulent shrub native to South Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant thrives in arid environments and is adapted to store water in its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. It blooms during the cooler months, typically in spring and autumn, and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value. The species is also known for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions.
